title: 2020 Summer Olympics
added: <!--Categories named after the event should say 2020; categories named to represent the event's actual date should say 2021.-->

title: 2020 Summer Olympics
added: On 29 April 2020, health experts expressed concern that the Tokyo Olympics might be cancelled if the pandemic should persist.<ref>{{Cite news|last=Rich|first=Motoko|last2=Keh|first2=Andrew|date=2020-04-28|title=Summer Olympics in 2021? 'Exceedingly Difficult' Without a Coronavirus Vaccine|language=en-US|work=The New York Times|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2020/04/28/sports/olympics/coronavirus-olympics-vaccine-tokyo.html|access-date=2020-05-03|issn=0362-4331|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200501210657/https://www.nytimes.com/2020/04/28/sports/olympics/coronavirus-olympics-vaccine-tokyo.html/|archive-date=1 May 2020|url-status=live}}</ref> In an interview with Japanese sports daily ''[[Nikkan Sports]]'', Organizing Committee president and former Japanese prime minister [[Yoshirō Mori]] asserted that the Games would be "scrapped" if they could not go ahead in 2021.<ref>{{cite web|date=2020-04-28|title=Next Olympics to be 'scrapped' if 2021 date is missed according to Tokyo 2020 president|url=https://www.rte.ie/sport/olympics/2020/0428/1135246-next-olympics-to-be-scrapped-if-2021-date-is-missed/|website=[[RTÉ.ie]]|access-date=2020-05-03|language=en|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200503203934/https://www.rte.ie/sport/olympics/2020/0428/1135246-next-olympics-to-be-scrapped-if-2021-date-is-missed/|archive-date=3 May 2020|url-status=live}}</ref> On 20 May 2020, Thomas Bach expressed in an interview with [[NBC Sports]] that the job of reorganising the Tokyo Games was "a mammoth task" and also admitted that the event would have to be cancelled altogether if it could not take place in the summer of 2021.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/olympics/52747797 |title=IOC's Thomas Bach accepts Tokyo Olympics would have to be cancelled if not held in 2021 |first=Dan |last=Roan |date=20 May 2020 |work=BBC Sport |access-date=21 May 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200521093705/https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/olympics/52747797 |archive-date=21 May 2020 |url-status=live }}</ref> Complete cancellation would cost Japan 4.52 trillion yen (US$41.5 billion), based on operating expenses and loss of tourism activity.<ref name="Costs" />

However, both Bach and Mori expressed optimism about the Games going ahead. [[Indian Olympic Association]] president Narinder Batra and [[World Health Organization]] director and general [[Tedros Adhanom]] also remained optimistic about the event being able to take place in 2021.<ref>{{Cite web|title=IOA President claims Tokyo 2020 Olympics will "definitely" take place|url=https://www.insidethegames.biz/articles/1093853/batra-claims-tokyo-2020-definite|date=3 May 2020|website=www.insidethegames.biz|accessdate=2020-05-03|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200505133343/https://www.insidethegames.biz/articles/1093853/batra-claims-tokyo-2020-definite|archive-date=5 May 2020|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last1=Wade |first1=Stephen |title=Tokyo Olympics followed up by 3 mega-events -- all in China |url=https://www.hotsr.com/news/2020/may/23/tokyo-olympics-followed-up-by-3-mega-ev/ |accessdate=23 May 2020 |agency=Associated Press |publisher=The Sentinel-Record}}</ref>
